accordion-info.delegator_rewards: Delegators rewards. How does it work
accordion-info.there_are_225_TEXT: There are 225 slots currently, as there are 225 validators.
accordion-info.an_slot_is_TEXT: An slot is the group of accounts that includes the validator account and its delegator accounts.
accordion-info.validators_acummulate_TEXT: Validators accumulate points for their activity. They have to sign validity statments and produce blocks to gain points.
accordion-info.at_the_end_TEXT: At the end of an era (6 epochs of 600 blocks each) the total reward is divided among the 225 slots based on their accumulated points.
accordion-info.once_each_slots_TEXT: Once each slots gets its reward, the commission of the validator is subtracted from the slot earnings.
accordion-info.the_rest_of_TEXT: The rest of the slot earnings is distributed among the delegators based in their percentaje of stake of in the slot.
accordion-info.risks_TEXT: According to the game rules, you may think that the most profitable validator is the one occuping the slot with less total stake. This is partially true, but you better consider the folowing risks. Last slot of the list (number 225 currently) has great chances of being out of the list in the next epoch. When a validator gets out of the list that validator and its nominators stop receiving rewards and its slot is occupied by a new validator. Slashing is a different kind of risk you may consider. When a validator misbehaves it suffers an slashing event. Slashing is the punishment for failing to follow the protocol. The punishment is applied to the validator and all delegators of its slot. Downtimes and equivocations (bad signing) are the most common reasons that trigger a slashing event. The only way to protect yourself from slashing events is to carefully chose the validators you are nominating. Studing its history, setup and reputation may help you when selecting the validators where you are depositing your trust (your stake)

support-us.i_enjoy_developing_TEXT: I enjoy developing PolkaStats and providing the services without annoying ads and I plan to continue doing it in that way :-).
support-us.if_you_like_TEXT: If you like my work and want to support the hosting payments or the time I spend developing and maintaining the server, you can do it in several ways.
support-us.we_love_feedback_TEXT: We love getting feedback from the community, if you find a bug, want to comment some behaviour or want a feature being added please place an Issue in our
support-us.this_is_an_TEXT: This is an easy way you can support me and the Polkadot folks at
